thread.title: 13 teams that have overcome 0-2 deficit to win best-of-seven series
thread.title_full: 13 teams that have overcome 0-2 deficit to win best-of-seven series | Chicago Sun-Times

title: 13 teams that have overcome 0-2 deficit to win best-of-seven series
text:
Down two games to none in the best-of-seven NLCS, the Cubs find themselves in a precarious position. But don’t count them out just yet.
Since MLB went to the best-of-seven format for the league championship series back in 1895, 25 teams have taken a 2-0 series lead. 22 of those teams went on to win the series.
But if you go back to 1903 and include all best-of-seven series played in Major League Baseball, 13 teams have overcome an 0-2 deficit.
Can the Cubs add themselves to the list?
13 MLB teams that have overcome an 0-2 deficit to win a best-of-seven series: Start Slideshow » In the midst of an 86-year championship drought, the Red Sox overcame an 0-3 deficit in the ALCS against the Yankees before going on to win the World Series | Doug Pensinger/Getty Images
After trailing the Yankees 0-2, the Dodgers came back to win the World Series in seven games. It was the only championship they won while in Brooklyn. This iconic photo shows Jackie Robinson stealing home against Yogi Berra in Game 1 | AP Photo/John Rooney
In the midst of an 86-year championship drought, the Red Sox overcame an 0-3 deficit in the ALCS against the Yankees before going on to win the World Series | Doug Pensinger/Getty Images
